text: I was overwhelmed with this cornucopia of historical culture and visited 3 times in 6 days.Be prepared to engorge your heart, mind and soul in the numerous collections laid out before you.

this museum always worth a visit no matter how many times you have already visited it. Huge collection well displayed and it offers fun for every age and interest. Another good reason for visit it? It is for free (permanet collection).

I went before we had tier 4 in this city and I felt incredibly safe and socially distanced.   The artefacts in each room were just breathtaking and take you through many different civilisations. The entrance is just beautiful! For any history lover I advise that this is the museum you see if you visit this city. As a Londoner I'm super surprised to took me so long to come and see it for myself.   The Egyptian artefacts in particular are beautiful.   A must see in this city!…

I only have good things to say about The this museum! The collection is phenomenal and the staff are very friendly. Facilities are clean, limited waiting time, excellent cafes and a fantastic place to learn more about Ancient Civilisations.

From the walk up to the building and then entering the grand hall you know this is a pretty special place. We went with young kids so couldn’t see everything before they reached their limited but they were super excited about at the stuff they saw and I te kong if you love history you could spend days wandering around this place and still find new things to intrigue. …

This exhibition is very well presented and gives the viewer an in depth look into the lifestyle, art, history and culture of those living in and around the Arctic Circle. I would thoroughly recommend going to see this.
Clean and quiet.... If you have time for museum visit, u should do it now... There is no crowd and it's really quite atmosphere.... Perfect <U+0001F44C>
My family  member has got his paintings here sadly he is passed away but his art lives on in this place
Enjoyable visit, plenty to see and good range of exhibits. Well manged one way route (unfortunately means you cant view everything), and plenty of staff on hand.
By far the best and most interesting museums in this city. Wide range of displays covering different periods of history.

The ground floor of the museum is a little bewildering but the contents of the museum as a whole are a great British treasure. It is a place that everyone should visit because there is so much to learn.

great day out for all of the family! something for everyone , so educational as well ! good for sight seeing as well
This museum offers you a travel from the ancient Egypt to the frontlines of World War 2. From the history museums I've ever seen, this seems to be the most complex.
The Parthenon marbles don't belong to here. It's unfortunate that this museum still not has returned it to one of the greatest buildings in Ancient times in Greece.
Booked tickets on line Turned up on time and straight in Felt safe Amazing to see the antiquities Great setting too Some of the smaller more compact areas closed but saw all the highlights Very good

Such an important and valuable collection.  Fascinating pieces on display.  A great day out with friends.

Really good museum for those interested in British history. It's been a few years since I went here last but it was nice to learn more information and see some great artifacts. Look forward to going again.

... this is the place for you. Loved wandering round the museum - even though the exhibits are not really my thing.

Amazing and it’s free.  Egypt was just like a childhood dream . Fascinating history and I wish I could book a trip to Egypt

The Egyptian displays are amazing we have visited Egypt many times and been lucky enough to see some of the wonderful sights. This is as good as it gets outside of the relics natural environment. Well worth a visit or two! The building is also amazing and easy to get to.
Great experience to explore  Egypt, Roman  and British Empire collection. Beautiful experience, beautiful place, with the whole world inside, a unique, unforgettable experience.

Nice place to drop when the rain take over this city. Friendly staff and nice organization. recommending to everyone!

I've been a regular visitor to the this museum for years and am reviewing my post lockdown visit.  It's less crowded though the queues to the loos are long.  You follow a one way route, and when I went it was just the ground floor.    It's still an amazing experience.

Beautiful  experience,  beautiful place, with the whole world inside, a unique, unforgettable experience.

One of the best museum I ever seen before : lots of masterpieces, a very nice building and a very nice organisation inside. You cannot don't go there if you travel in this city. Only a fool can avoided the this museum. If you like history please don't miss the Rosetta Stone.…

It's do popular to the world it makes me proud to be a British citizen . The loveliest part of this city to. I’m a massive fan of Egyptology so it was perfect . The staff, security and workers on the cafe and shops are so friendly . Not easy during Covid 19. Well organised
When you visit this museum, you step back thousands of years of history. Be prepared to expand your horizons and reconnect with past civilizations and humanity's genius.
